Html:
I have reviewed other posts and cannot seem to find anything on target for my issue. Using the "local" option I can never connect.

Without the "local" option I can connect using FQDN & NETBIOS (configured IIS to respond) on port 80, 443, 8530, & 8531. I have a wildcard web certificate that I am using on 443 and 8531.

I can TELNET to all the key ports from the local machine. I setup WPP on another server and can connect fine but of course cannot create a certificate. I can setup a CA for the domain and issue certificates, but that seems more work then solving the connection. I did try (for S&G) to use my wildcard certificate but of course it is not authorized for this type of signing. Let me know what details I need to provide to help solve this and thank you.

Are you using WPP directly on your WSUS? Which Port is your WSUS using? If 8531 (SSL) then you have to select [X] Connect to local Server, Connection Port 8531 and select SSL.

At the Startscreen from your WSUS you can see which port is your WSUS using. Look here: http://www.wsus.de/images/wsus-version.png

I have left local unchecked, made those changes then checked the use local. Confirmed those values are the only entry in the options.xml file and no success. Those same settings work fine with the local flag off from WSUS and other domain member server. Any cheap code sign cert sources?

Brent Quick
Networking/Infrastructure Consultant

12-C Oak Branch Dr. | Greensboro, NC 27407
Cell: (336) 338-2263
Direct/Fax: (336)Â­ 217-5063

IMPORTANT NOTICE: This e-mail message is intended to be received only by persons entitled to receive the confidential information it may contain. E-mail messages to clients of Intelligent Technologies, Inc may contain information that is confidential and legally privileged. Please do not read, copy, forward, or store this message unless you are an intended recipient of it. If you have received this message in error, please forward it to the sender and delete it completely from your computer system.

I have already seen this. The Wsus administrator had activated SSL on the server and mess with settings.
Does this server is in production ?

1) I am the admin who activated SSL as the recommended in the deployment guide.
2) I can change the settings at anytime if needed.
3) The server is used only to approve/manage updates but clients pull from MS servers.
4) If the WPP tool cannot handle 8531 SSL port but requires 443 that is fine.

I can get my cert and then change back for the GPO. I can also setup a Domain CA and deploy certificates, but that is more trouble.

Thanks
I have SSL on Port 8531, WPP is working with this configuration for me without any problems.

WinfriedSonntag wrote:
I have SSL on Port 8531, WPP is working with this configuration for me without any problems.
I am glad, but not sure how that helps. Below is the relevant version and ports as requested.


I am logged in to the WSUS via RDP (console session) and using Domain Admin account.
I have checked the local security policy and most everything recommended and it just doesn't want to connect.
If I need to put fiddler or similar and capture the local traffic I can.

Options.XML
<WsusPackagePublisher>
  <Server>
    <Name>WSUS01.DOMAIN.TLD</Name>
    <IsLocal>True</IsLocal>
    <Port>8531</Port>
    <UseSSL>True</UseSSL>
    <IgnoreCertErrors>False</IgnoreCertErrors>
    <DeadLineDaysSpan>0</DeadLineDaysSpan>
    <DeadLineHour>0</DeadLineHour>
    <DeadLineMinute>0</DeadLineMinute>
    <VisibleInWsusConsole>Never</VisibleInWsusConsole>
  </Server>
</WsusPackagePublisher>
